intro: Sebaea congesta, commonly known as the clustered sebaea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow or orange. Its leaves are opposite and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Sebaea congesta is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun conditions.
